page.title: 14CHILDREN IN CLIFTON HAMPDEN
page.content:
There is a marked absence of young families in the village. Fifteen children attend the pre-school play- group but only four of these actually live in Clifton Hampden. These four are the only children in the 3 to 5 years ge group living in the village.
The primary school is small with only one full time teacher and some part time helpers. There are about 20 children on the roll. The headteacher from the school is on sabbatical for the 1984-85 school year. He is a firm believer in the advantages of the small rural school and is using the year to study the ways in which small schools function.
Many of the older children go to independent schools, others attend the comprehensive school in Berinsfield.
